in judging by it changes 
in celestial phenomena.
The absence of certain 
stars upon a plate, or an 
increase in the number,
or variability in the size 
of the photographic star discs,
do not necessarily indicate 
variability in the object,
but only some instrumental 
or atmospheric effect, and 
before we attempt to general-
ise from photographic evidence 
the properties of both reflecting 
and refracting instruments 
will have to be studied
